Deprecated API

Contents

  • Exceptions
  • Methods
  • Deprecated Exceptions
    Exceptions
    Description
    oracle.nosql.driver.TableBusyException
    this class is no longer used
  • Deprecated Methods
    Method
    Description
    oracle.nosql.driver.NoSQLHandleConfig.getConnectionPoolSize()
    The connection pool no longer supports a size setting. It will expand as needed based on concurrent demand.
    oracle.nosql.driver.NoSQLHandleConfig.getPoolMaxPending()
    The connection pool no longer supports pending requests.
    oracle.nosql.driver.NoSQLHandleConfig.setConnectionPoolSize(int)
    The connection pool no longer supports a size setting. It will expand as needed based on concurrent demand.
    oracle.nosql.driver.NoSQLHandleConfig.setPoolMaxPending(int)
    The connection pool no longer supports pending requests.
    oracle.nosql.driver.ops.QueryRequest.getContinuationKey()
     
    oracle.nosql.driver.ops.QueryRequest.setContinuationKey(byte[])
    There is no reason to use this method anymore, because setting the continuation key is now done internally.
    oracle.nosql.driver.ops.TableResult.waitForState(NoSQLHandle, String, String, TableResult.State, int, int)
    use TableResult.waitForCompletion(oracle.nosql.driver.NoSQLHandle, int, int) instead. Waits for the specified table to reach the desired state. This is a blocking, polling style wait that delays for the specified number of milliseconds between each polling operation. The state of TableResult.State.DROPPED is treated specially in that it will be returned as success, even if the table does not exist. Other states will throw an exception if the table is not found.
    oracle.nosql.driver.ops.TableResult.waitForState(NoSQLHandle, String, TableResult.State, int, int)
    use TableResult.waitForCompletion(oracle.nosql.driver.NoSQLHandle, int, int) instead. Waits for the specified table to reach the desired state. This is a blocking, polling style wait that delays for the specified number of milliseconds between each polling operation. The state of TableResult.State.DROPPED is treated specially in that it will be returned as success, even if the table does not exist. Other states will throw an exception if the table is not found.
    oracle.nosql.driver.ops.TableResult.waitForState(NoSQLHandle, TableResult, TableResult.State, int, int)
    use TableResult.waitForCompletion(oracle.nosql.driver.NoSQLHandle, int, int) instead. Waits for the specified table to reach the desired state. This is a blocking, polling style wait that delays for the specified number of milliseconds between each polling operation. The state of TableResult.State.DROPPED is treated specially in that it will be returned as success, even if the table does not exist. Other states will throw an exception if the table is not found.
